  • django.core.files.uploadhandler
  • View page source

django.core.files.uploadhandler

Base file upload handler classes, and the built-in concrete subclasses

Exceptions

UploadFileException

Any error having to do with uploading files.

StopUpload

This exception is raised when an upload must abort.

SkipFile

This exception is raised by an upload handler that wants to skip a given file.

StopFutureHandlers

Upload handlers that have handled a file and do not want future handlers to

Classes

FileUploadHandler

Base class for streaming upload handlers.

TemporaryFileUploadHandler

Upload handler that streams data into a temporary file.

MemoryFileUploadHandler

File upload handler to stream uploads into memory (used for small files).

Functions

load_handler(path, *args, **kwargs)

Given a path to a handler, return an instance of that handler.

Module Contents

exception django.core.files.uploadhandler.UploadFileException[source]

Bases: Exception

Any error having to do with uploading files.

exception django.core.files.uploadhandler.StopUpload(connection_reset=False)[source]

Bases: UploadFileException

This exception is raised when an upload must abort.

connection_reset = False[source]
exception django.core.files.uploadhandler.SkipFile[source]

Bases: UploadFileException

This exception is raised by an upload handler that wants to skip a given file.

exception django.core.files.uploadhandler.StopFutureHandlers[source]

Bases: UploadFileException

Upload handlers that have handled a file and do not want future handlers to run should raise this exception instead of returning None.

class django.core.files.uploadhandler.FileUploadHandler(request=None)[source]

Base class for streaming upload handlers.

chunk_size = 65536[source]
file_name = None[source]
content_type = None[source]
content_length = None[source]
charset = None[source]
content_type_extra = None[source]
request = None[source]
handle_raw_input(input_data, META, content_length, boundary, encoding=None)[source]

Handle the raw input from the client.

:paraminput_data:

An object that supports reading via .read().

:paramMETA:

request.META.

:paramcontent_length:

The (integer) value of the Content-Length header from the client.

:paramboundary: The boundary from the Content-Type header. Be sure to

prepend two ‘–‘.

new_file(field_name, file_name, content_type, content_length, charset=None, content_type_extra=None)[source]

Signal that a new file has been started.

Warning: As with any data from the client, you should not trust content_length (and sometimes won’t even get it).

abstractmethod receive_data_chunk(raw_data, start)[source]

Receive data from the streamed upload parser. start is the position in the file of the chunk.

abstractmethod file_complete(file_size)[source]

Signal that a file has completed. File size corresponds to the actual size accumulated by all the chunks.

Subclasses should return a valid UploadedFile object.

upload_complete()[source]

Signal that the upload is complete. Subclasses should perform cleanup that is necessary for this handler.

upload_interrupted()[source]

Signal that the upload was interrupted. Subclasses should perform cleanup that is necessary for this handler.

class django.core.files.uploadhandler.TemporaryFileUploadHandler(request=None)[source]

Bases: FileUploadHandler

Upload handler that streams data into a temporary file.

new_file(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Create the file object to append to as data is coming in.

receive_data_chunk(raw_data, start)[source]

Receive data from the streamed upload parser. start is the position in the file of the chunk.

file_complete(file_size)[source]

Signal that a file has completed. File size corresponds to the actual size accumulated by all the chunks.

Subclasses should return a valid UploadedFile object.

upload_interrupted()[source]

Signal that the upload was interrupted. Subclasses should perform cleanup that is necessary for this handler.

class django.core.files.uploadhandler.MemoryFileUploadHandler(request=None)[source]

Bases: FileUploadHandler

File upload handler to stream uploads into memory (used for small files).

handle_raw_input(input_data, META, content_length, boundary, encoding=None)[source]

Use the content_length to signal whether or not this handler should be used.

new_file(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Signal that a new file has been started.

Warning: As with any data from the client, you should not trust content_length (and sometimes won’t even get it).

receive_data_chunk(raw_data, start)[source]

Add the data to the BytesIO file.

file_complete(file_size)[source]

Return a file object if this handler is activated.

django.core.files.uploadhandler.load_handler(path, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Given a path to a handler, return an instance of that handler.

E.g.::
>>> from django.http import HttpRequest
>>> request = HttpRequest()
>>> load_handler(
...     'django.core.files.uploadhandler.TemporaryFileUploadHandler',
...     request,
... )
<TemporaryFileUploadHandler object at 0x...>
